Name of Convention: Convention on Wetlands on International Importance Especially as Waterfowl Habitat (Ramsar) (1971)
Major Obligation: Conservation, management and wise use of migratory waterfowl and promotion of wetland conservation.
Formulation and implementation of measures to make wise use of wetlands.
Achievements: Declaration of nine wetlands as Ramsar sites.
EIA has been made mandatory to hydro power and irrigation projects.

Name of Convention: Convention on the International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora (1973)
Major Obligation: Protection and regulation in the trade of wild fauna and flora and their products

Achievements: MOFSC has declared protected plants and animals of Nepal

Major Obligation: Legal protection to all species threatened with extinction with appropriate measures and trade regulation

Achievements: Establishment of CITES section in the DNPWC

Name of Convention: The Convention on the Conservation of Migratory Species of Wild Animals (1979)
Major Obligation: Protection of migratory species of wild animals that live within or pass their national jurisdiction.

Name of Convention: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (1992)
Major Obligation: Adoption of precautionary measures to prevent or minimize the release of greenhouse gases and mitigate effects of climate change.
Achievements: Formulation and implementation of Climate Change Policy, NAPA, LAPA, R-PP, Environment Protection Act (1997).
Preparation of Nepal vehicle pollution standard (1999).

Name of Convention: United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification (1994)
Major Obligation: Adoption of measures to combat desertification
Achievements: Preparation of national action plan to combat desertification

Major Obligation: Addressing the physical, biological, and socio economic aspects of the processes of desertification and drought
Achievements: Preparation and presentation of three national reports on land degradation

Name of Convention: Plant Protection Agreement for the South East Asia and Pacific Region (1956)
Major Obligation: Prevent introduction into and spread of destructive plant diseases and pests
Regulate trade in plants and plant products

Name of Convention: Agreement on the Network of Aquaculture Centers in Asia and the Pacific (1988)

Name of Convention: Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety to the CBD (2000)
Major Obligation: Contribute to ensuring an adequate level of protection in the field of the safe transfer, handling and use of living modified organisms resulting from modern biotechnology that may have adverse effects on the conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity
Achievements: Plant Protection Act, 2007; Biosafety Guidelines (2005); National Biosafety Framework Policy (2007)
